solution_line_template: She uses {beans_per_day} ounces of beans per day because {cups_per_day} x {beans_per_cup} = <<{cups_per_day}*{beans_per_cup}={beans_per_day}>>{beans_per_day}
She uses {beans_per_week} ounces of beans per week because {days_per_week} x {beans_per_day} = <<{days_per_week}*{beans_per_day}={beans_per_week}>>{beans_per_week}
She buys {bags_per_week} bags of beans per week because {beans_per_week} / {ounces_per_bag} = <<{beans_per_week}/{ounces_per_bag}={bags_per_week}>>{bags_per_week}
She spends ${beans_cost_per_week} on the beans per week because {bags_per_week} x {cost_per_bag} = <<{beans_cost_per_week}={beans_cost_per_week}>>{beans_cost_per_week}
She spends ${milk_cost_per_week} on the milk per week because {cost_per_gallon_milk} x ({milk_per_week}) = <<{cost_per_gallon_milk}*{milk_per_week}={milk_cost_per_week}>>{milk_cost_per_week}

She spends ${total_cost_per_week} per week on her coffee because {beans_cost_per_week} + {milk_cost_per_week} = <<{beans_cost_per_week}+{milk_cost_per_week}={total_cost_per_week}>>{total_cost_per_week}
